metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11135 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
TSX Asynchronous Abort condition on some CPUs utilizing speculative execution may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via a side channel with local access. Stephan van Schaik, Alyssa Milburn, Sebastian Österlund, Pietro Frigo, Kaveh Razavi, Herbert Bos, Cristiano Giuffrida, Giorgi Maisuradze, Moritz Lipp, Michael Schwarz, Daniel Gruss, and Jo Van Bulck discovered that Intel processors using Transactional Synchronization Extensions (TSX) could expose memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural buffers to a malicious process that is executing on the same CPU core. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20191112-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Stephan van Schaik, Alyssa Milburn, Sebastian Österlund, Pietro Frigo, Kaveh Razavi, Herbert Bos, Cristiano Giuffrida, Giorgi Maisuradze, Moritz Lipp, Michael Schwarz, Daniel Gruss, and Jo Van Bulck

notes.Note: tyhicks> This issue only affects processors manufactured by Intel that support Intel® Transactional Synchronization Extensions (TSX)

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20191112-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.109').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.68').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1049.52').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.69').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.135').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.68').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1049.52').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.138').
